projects.title: Wings.cheap
projects.description: Built a web app for finding cheap wings near you.

projects.title: Nissan: Recalls
projects.description: Rebuilt the Nissan/Infiniti recalls web application to be fully responsive. Had only 5 days to fully complete.

projects.title: Blueshield: Content Build System
projects.description:
Blueshield California wanted to redesign their digital customer experience. Critical Mass was hired to help with that.

Blueshield uses a unique CMS which requires each page to be built with custom elements. Rather than us manually coding in these elements, we thought it would be a smart to automate some of the tedious work. We built a templating system which allowed us to both QA our pages with dummy content, as well as deliver the pages with these transformed elements.

On top of this, I also flew to California a couple of times to help their team build their pages. This required me to mentor some of their web developers, communicate/strategize with their tech leads, and help solve some problems they were facing.

projects.title: Infiniti: Tree Drive
projects.description:
Built a reveal page for Infiniti's winter sales event. For each test drive, they will plant a tree in America.

This project was very creative heavy, and required me to work closely with designers. I took their PSD and built the page around it. As a bonus, we built an SVG of the states, converted it into several polygons, and then animated the individual polygons. The result is a beautiful animation when navigating the page.

images.title: An example of the landing screen (after animation).
Demonstration of how the animation behaves.
An example of a region (after you fill out form/click map).

projects.title: Splash Loader
projects.description:
Built a little splash loading animation while I was bored one rainy afternoon. Uses the prototype methodology and supports reopening and closing.

See source code on GitHub

projects.title: Portfolio v2
projects.description:
Built this portfolio from scratch to showcase my experience with web technologies. I wanted to build a system which was easily maintainable, responsive, and used some fun next-level technologies.

This portfolio was built using KnockoutJS (try filtering these projects from the header or from a skills accordian), JSON for storing content (this information and more is coming from an ajax request), Gulp for minifying code; compressing images; enabling livereload; and more. It also contains some fun front-end features. The header of this page is using filters to alter the hue and is multiplying the background-image with the background-gradient to create a unique effect.

Make sure you're on an up-to-date browser for best results.

See the source code on GitHub.

projects.title: CSS3 Icons
projects.description:
Wrote some icons in pure CSS3 a couple years ago, however recently updated them to use SASS, rely on variables, and be open sourced.

Check it out on GitHub.

images.title: Google Chrome icon made with pure CSS
Rdio (you'll be missed) and Habbo Hotel icons in pure CSS
Side project app icon in pure CSS.

projects.title: Nissan: Responsive website redesign
projects.description:
We had 4 months to rebuild the Nissan USA and Infiniti USA websites. This was a great opportunity to develop and demonstrate time-management skills, planning, and teamwork.

We built the system using a style guide, which allowed us to easily reuse components throughout the website. My team of 4 took on the configurator and applications. My main contributions involved building configurator. This required several technical deliverables such as building page controllers on both server and client side (Java, GSP, Javascript), modifying the styleguide internal workings (GulpJS), and building responsive components (FoundationJS, Javascript, SCSS). Nearly all components in the configurator were built or modified by me.

Check out the configurator here: Nissan | Infiniti (you currently can only access on mobile)

projects.title: Portfolio v1
projects.description:
Built this portfolio from scratch to showcase my experience with web technologies. I wanted to build a system which was easily maintainable, responsive, and used some fun next-level technologies.

This portfolio was built using AngularJS (try filtering these projects from the header or from a skills accordian), JSON for storing content (this information and more is coming from an ajax request), Gulp for minifying code; compressing images; enabling livereload; and more. It also contains some fun front-end features. The header of this page is using filters to alter the hue and is multiplying the background-image with the background-gradient to create a unique effect.

Make sure you're on an up-to-date browser for best results.

projects.title: BetterDo.
projects.description: Version 2 of my Todo app was a complete rewrite. Moved to Ajax based communication and LESS for styling.

projects.title: Broken City: Point of sale system
projects.description: For our capstone project at SAIT four of us developed a point of sale system for Broken City. We put an emphasis on speed, ease of use, and modern design. Wrote the front-end using JSPs and the back-end using Java and MySQL.

projects.title: CSS3: Stack Loading Animation
projects.description: Developed a stack loading effect using CSS3 animations.

projects.title: CSS3: USB/Lightening Connector
projects.description: Developed an Apple lightning cable and USB connector in pure CSS3.

projects.title: Classic Kennels
projects.description: Developed a web form for a local company called KlassicKennels for their grand opening. Got over 1k votes an hour, with a grand total of over 30k in the 14 day campaign.

projects.title: MyBobba
projects.description: Habbo is a popular online world for teenagers. During my younger teens I built a fansite for the game which allowed users to upload pictures of themselves and have unmoderated chat. It got very popular with about 1k hits a day. Unfortunately, I couldn't afford bandwidth and had to close its doors.

projects.title: MyPereira
projects.description: One of the first websites I built. This project was an advanced take on a family website. It had features like messaging, profiles, photo uploads, video sharing, etc.
